title.narrative: Contributing to Reduced Vulnerabilities of Migrants in Albania

description.narrative: The Government of Norway has contributed to the Albania SDG Acceleration Fund to be used for the implementation of activities in accordance with the Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation for Sustainable Development 2017-2021 - as indicated in the signed Government of Albania – United Nations Joint Work Plans - and in accordance with Norway’s development priorities for Albania: Improved capacity building, good governance and democratic development. Strengthened rule of law and human rights. Strengthened economic development. The project is part of the UN Annual Work plan 2020-2021 for the Output 1.6 Migration and Asylum. In the context of increased pressure on border management, IOM proposes a response with the general objective of contributing to improved protection of migrants at border crossing points in Albania. The project will focus on increasing knowledge and skills of officials responsible for border management and will seek to improve referral and assistance for migrants in vulnerable situations, including victims of trafficking/potential victims of trafficking (VoT/PVoT) mainly focusing in Korce and Gjirokaster, the border crossing with the highest number of migrants crossing.

participating-org.narrative: SDGs Acceleration Fund for Albania - MPTF

mailing-address.narrative: “Brigada VIII”, Nd. LID, Kt. 3, Apt. 303, Tirana, Albania

sector.narrative: Protection and Assistance to Vulnerable Migrants

policy-marker.narrative: Project with some but insufficient inclusion of gender issues

provider-org.narrative: SDGs Acceleration Fund for Albania - MPTF
